docs.snippet: LONDON, Nov. 12. -- The British torpedo cruiser Serpent has foundered off the coast of Spain. Out of a total of 250 persons on board only 3 were saved....
docs.abstract: Serpent, British Torpedo Cruiser, Wrecked; Two hundred and Fifty Lost
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Nov. 12. -- The British torpedo cruiser Serpent has foundered off the coast of Spain. Out of a total of 250 persons on board only 3 were saved.

headline.main: A BRITISH CRUISER SUNK; THE SERPENT LOST, WITH FROM 250 TO 275 LIVES. THE WAR VESSEL GOES ON THE ROCKS NEAR CAPE FINISTERRE -- ONLY THREE PERSONS SAVED.

docs.snippet: HALIFAX, N.S., Oct. 9. -- The court-martial held at Bermuda on account of the war ship Pylades running ashore resulted in the Captain being reprimanded and the engineer dismissed from the ship. Three sailors were also court-martialed. One of the m...
docs.lead_paragraph: HALIFAX, N.S., Oct. 9. -- The court-martial held at Bermuda on account of the war ship Pylades running ashore resulted in the Captain being reprimanded and the engineer dismissed from the ship. Three sailors were also court-martialed. One of the men imprisoned broke some rule and received eighteen lashes. He was afterward tried and got twelve months' imprisonment and his discharge.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 2. -- The British steamer Portuense, Capt. Hews, from New-York, Aug. 17, for Para and Maceio, has foundered near Anegada Island, British West Indies. Nineteen of her crew are known to have been saved. The Captain, first and third off...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 2. -- The British steamer Portuense, Capt. Hews, from New-York, Aug. 17, for Para and Maceio, has foundered near Anegada Island, British West Indies. Nineteen of her crew are known to have been saved. The Captain, first and third officers, chief engineer, two stewards, boatswain, carpenter, and a fireman and seaman are missing.

docs.snippet: PROVIDENCE, Aug. 2. -- The excursion steamer Mount Hope took about seven hundred passengers from this city to-day on her regular Block Island trip. The fog was quite thick outside, but Capt. Orswell made the breakwater at about the usual time. The...
docs.lead_paragraph: PROVIDENCE, Aug. 2. -- The excursion steamer Mount Hope took about seven hundred passengers from this city to-day on her regular Block Island trip. The fog was quite thick outside, but Capt. Orswell made the breakwater at about the usual time. The Government steamer John Rodgers was anchored 600 feet west of the breakwater and 300 feet north of the new harbor wall with a sloop yacht at anchor 200 feet away.

headline.main: MOUNT HOPE STRIKES A ROCK.; THE ACCIDENT ONLY A SLLIGHT ONE -THE PASSENGERS LANDED SAFELY.

docs.snippet: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., July 29. -- The steamship Franconia, from New-York to Fernandina in ballast, went ashore on the shoals north of The Boilers, near the entrance to the harbor of Fernandina, late last night, and was burned this morning to the wat...
docs.lead_paragraph: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., July 29. -- The steamship Franconia, from New-York to Fernandina in ballast, went ashore on the shoals north of The Boilers, near the entrance to the harbor of Fernandina, late last night, and was burned this morning to the water's edge. She left New-York July 23 to load phosphate at Fernandina for Baltimore, and had been expected to arrive for the past three days.

headline.main: THE FRANCONIA BURNED.; SHE HAD A ROUGH PASSAGE FROM THIS PORT, BUT THE CREW WERE SAVED.

docs.snippet: The steamer Eleanora, which ran into the excursion barge Walter Sands in Hell Gate Saturday evening, proceeded after the accident as far as Flushing Bay, where she anchored until morning. About fifty of her seventy-five passengers were transferred...
docs.abstract: Eleanora's Collision with Excursion Barge W. Sands in Hell Gate
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer Eleanora, which ran into the excursion barge Walter Sands in Hell Gate Saturday evening, proceeded after the accident as far as Flushing Bay, where she anchored until morning. About fifty of her seventy-five passengers were transferred to passing tugs, which brought them to town in time to catch trains for the East.

headline.main: A HAWSER AND HELL GATE; CAUSES OF THE ACCIDENT TO THE PICNIC BARGES. CAPT. BRAGG OF THE ELEANORA TELLS THE STORY OF THE COLLISION -- THE INJURED DOING NICELY.

docs.snippet: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 1.--The steamship Gaelic, which arrived from China and Japan to-day, brings news that the American ship Cheesborough was wrecked Oct. 30 by running on the rocks off Sluchi-Ri-Hama, and nineteen of the crew drowned....
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 1.--The steamship Gaelic, which arrived from China and Japan to-day, brings news that the American ship Cheesborough was wrecked Oct. 30 by running on the rocks off Sluchi-Ri-Hama, and nineteen of the crew drowned.

headline.main: NINETEEN WERE DROWNED.; AN AMERICAN SHIP WRECKED AND ONLY FOUR OF HER CREW SAVED.

headline.main: STORIES OF SURVIVORS.; OFFICER NELSON AND PURSER VOSE ON THE LOSS OF THE MANHATTAN.
